title: The One Simple Way to Stop Feeling ‚ÄòBehind in Life‚Äô and Start Moving Forward (Even if Your Brain Feels Like a Ping-Pong Match)
subtitle: You‚Äôll finally stop feeling like you're running a race where everyone else got a head start... and you‚Äôre still looking for your shoes.
author: Rhys Morgan
content_html:
A few months ago a client was with me and he said “I sat on my couch yesterday... in pajamas that should’ve been retired three years ago... scrolling through LinkedIn. Someone posted “Just bought my third house at 29!!! 🏡💼 Feeling #blessed”I immediately felt like a melted jellybean I’m 35 and I live in a rental that smells suspiciously like old onions.

So I told him that I’m still figuring out how to reply to emails without having an existential crisis.

If you’re neurodivergent (hi ADHD, autism, or a messy beautiful mix of both)... you know this feeling isn’t new.

You’re not lazy. You’re not broken.

You’re just running a different kind of marathon.

And guess what? You’re gonna need a different game plan.

Here’s the secret that nobody told me until I ugly-cried in my therapist's office:

You’re not "behind." You’re on your own timeline.

If you’ve ever tried to use a planner and ended up doodling in it for three hours... you know the "standard roadmap to success" doesn't fit.

You need a messy, colorful, neurodivergent-friendly roadmap.

One that lets you move forward at your own speed... even if that means sprinting one day and lying on the floor the next.

3 Things That Helped Me (After I Failed Miserably for Years)

1. Ditch the Timeline Myth.

There’s no deadline for "being a real adult."

Buying a house at 25? Cool. Renting until 45? Also cool.

Living in a van? Amazing. Starting a PhD at 50? Iconic.

Your life isn’t a late-night infomercial with a limited-time offer.

You’re not expired milk.

You’re a whole damn galaxy.

Own it.

2. Create Tiny Wins.

Big goals used to paralyze me.

Finish a book? LOL. Clean my whole apartment? Sure, in another universe.

So I started with tiny, ridiculous goals.

  • Put on real pants (check)

  • Drink one glass of water (check)

  • Reply to one email without spiraling into dread (check)

Tiny wins are not tiny.

They’re rocket fuel.

3. Romanticize Your Weird Path.

Start thinking about your life like it's the most epic indie movie ever.

You’re the main character... wandering through plot twists... eating cereal for dinner... building a life that nobody else could.

Your quirks are not barriers. They’re Easter eggs.

Stuff that’ll make your story unforgettable.

Real Talk: It’s Not Always Gonna Feel Good.

Some days you’re gonna feel like a majestic phoenix rising from the ashes.

Other days... like a pancake someone dropped on the floor.

Both are valid.

Both are proof you’re moving.

So… How Do You Actually Start Moving Forward?

Start messy.

Start tired.

Start late.

Start when you're confused.

Just start.

Momentum looks like magic from the outside... but it’s really just a bunch of weird, tiny, stubborn starts stacked on top of each other.

Final Takeaway:

You’re not behind in life.

You’re just on a different road... and your GPS is glitchy... but you're still getting somewhere beautiful.
